title: State persists even making a new compilation
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (7398b65 2023-03-30T00:09:40.119345Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge script

### Operating System

macOS (Intel)

### Describe the bug

After changing the code inside my contracts, when running the command `forge script scripts/InitialDep.s.sol:MyInitialScript --fork-url localhost --broadcast` it makes the compilation but the script is run as if it is using the previous code. 

E.g 
```
Changed `console.log("previousCode");` to `console.log("currentCode");`
```
`forge script ...`

```
forge script scripts/InitialDep.s.sol:MyInitialScript --fork-url localhost --broadcast
zsh: correct 'script' to 'scripts' [nyae]? n
[Раб] Compiling...
[Рає] Compiling 1 files with 0.8.19
previousCode
```
Its compiling changes so I have no idea why it keeps using the previous codebase. 
I thought of deleting cache files in case it was getting a previous state mistakenly but now I have tried deleting all the autogenerated files: ./out ./broadcast ./forge-cache etc. and nothing seems to make it work.
could you please prepare a repro for this?

@mattsse I can confirm that whats causing the bug is using the --broadcast flag. So here is a breakdown of the process to fail:

Script:
`forge script scripts/InitialDep.s.sol:MyInitialScript --fork-url localhost`

1. I run the script with `--broadcast` flag for the first time ==> Code runs smothly
2. I run the script with `--broadcast` flag for the second time (either having changes or not) ==> Code uses past codebase 
3. I kill `anvil` and restart it. Run again the script with the `--broadcast` flag ==> Code runs smoothly

Whereas when I run the script without `--broadcast` it runs well every time.

It this expected behaviour? Maybe Im not understanding what is the proper way to use --broadcast...

Hello @mattsse . Foundry has been working perfectly and all of a sudden its taking me again to a previous state. I tried checking out a commit I flagged in the past as "passing tests" and its failing with a previous state. How can I debug this?

Hey,

sorry about that.

> and all of a sudden its taking me again to a previous state

I'm not exactly sure what this means. Do you mean it doesn't recompile?

I appreciate the example contract, but it would help me tremendously if you could prepare a repository and instructions that I can just run and debug.
